result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leah Margret Clark

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leah Margret Clark appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Leah Margret Clark.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Case is adjourned to 1-27-23 at 8:30 am for a review hearing by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Review hearing scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Early Intervention Program Child Protective Advocacy Deferred Prosecution Agreement, filed.

Defendant Leah Margret Clark appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Leah Margret Clark.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing.  Defense is requesting an adjournment for reasons stated on the record.  Case is adjourned to 10-11-22 at 9:00 am for a DPA hearing.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Parties are requesting a Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing.  Case is adjourned to 9-12-22 at 2:00 pm for DPA hearing by zoom.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Leah Margret Clark in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Parties are negotiating and requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 8-1-22 at 8:30 am for status conference.  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leah Margret Clark in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Leah Margret Clark appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leah Margret Clark in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Leah Margret Clark appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional status conference held.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leah Margret Clark in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Parties are negotiating and requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 5-25-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference by zoom.
  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leah Margret Clark in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case was scheduled for DPA entry. Defendant is no longer eligible for DPA. Case reassigned to Branch 10. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Oral No Contact Order with A.J.C. unless as approved by the Waukesha Department of Children and Family.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Leah Margret Clark in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Leah Margret Clark appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom.   Defendant waives In Person appearance; Matter live streamed on Dacast.
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.
Case adjourned for entry into DPA in branch 21. 
Case will be heard in room 310SB.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
